text: Council Regulation (EC) No 2157/2001 of 8 October 2001 on the Statute for a European company (SE) is an EU law requiring member states to recognise the European Company as capable of being registered in each member state. ==See also== *EU law *Societas Europaea *Employee Involvement Directive 2001/86/EC *European company law ==External links== *Council Regulation (EC) No 2157/2001 of 8 October 2001 on the Statute for a European company (SE) *Consolidated version of 1 July 2013 Category:European Union law
title: Statute for a European Company Regulation 2001
